question: These days, more and more people move away from the area where they were born and brought up when they become adults.Do the advantages of this development outweigh the disadvantages?
text: Undoubtedly, in today's fast-paced era, the trend of immigration has been skyrocketed. The majority of young adults leave their home country while being matured. This phenomenon has its own boons as well as pitfalls. Notwithstanding, this disquisition delves into both outlooks, and subsequently explores why drawbacks supersede the benefits.

Apparently, the key plus point of migrating to foreign country could be in search of personal development and quality of life. The fact is that many of these youngsters might born in a populous nation where the resources of education, healthcare and employment are not enough, which is the fundamental requirement of an individual to live a life with fulfilment and sense of achievement. Sometimes it also could be possible that younglings are extremely intelligent and knowledgeable but are deprived of getting chances to clinch success; consequently, immigration happens. Almost one person from one family, for exemplification, migrates to the USA from India, seeking not only individual betterment but also to fulfill their family's need. Secondly, these emigrated youth contribute to host countries' tax systems to a certain level, on which the welcoming country's economy is dependent to a great level.

Conversely, this trend also has seen the great numbers of drawbacks. The main negative point here might losing such an intelligent professional to developed nations, for the sake of lacking opportunities in their mother countries. This is called 'brain-drain', when knowledgeable and highly educated people migrate to developed country, and developing nations could face a paucity of educative community. I believe this trend is not beneficial for their birth countries. Moreover, at a personal level also, many younglings face the inequality, racial issues, feeling of avoidance from people of host country, which is enough to dwindle down a strong person's confidence and dedication. A survey by GNA (Guardian Newspaper of America) stated that, due to cultural differences and racism movements, many people in the USA faced emotional trauma and post traumatic stress disorders, in last 10 years. Thus, immigration is not always can be advantageous.
To conclude, having advanced both standpoints, I recapitulate that there are numerous benefits as well as demerits; however, what I feel is disadvantages outweigh advantages.
